segments.text: I'm focused on the woman again, still diligently polishing that plate.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her posture is so calm, so absorbed in her domestic routine.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She's completely in her own world, a bubble of peace in the kitchen.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's almost beautiful, this moment of quiet concentration.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: How can someone be so utterly oblivious to everything around her?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The overflowing water, the kids' antics, she senses none of it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder what she's thinking about, what peaceful thoughts occupy her mind.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Perhaps she's humming a tune, or planning dinner.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's a curious thing, the human capacity for selective attention.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She looks almost serene, despite the gathering mayhem.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: A part of me envies her ability to tune out the world so completely.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Yet, it also makes me uneasy, knowing what she is missing.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her face shows no strain, just a gentle, focused expression.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's a testament to the power of routine, even in an unusual setting.
segments.speaker: PAR
